item.title: Illuminated Sign Lights, 14th July
item.description:
Outside Cobans Kitchen restaurant, Arnsberg Way, Bexleyheath: The illuminated lights for a “No U-Turn” sign have been hit by a vehicle meaning the lights are no longer over the sign - asset ID number 13. Please could the sign lights be realigned. Picture attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arnsberg Way, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chatsworth Road Estate Dump Rubbish, 14th July
item.description:
Household rubbish had been dumped on Chatsworth Road Estate grounds behind properties 152 and 154 Elderfield Road E5 0AZ for more than a month. The area alongside 152 Elderfield Road and the Estate need a clean up - overgrown vegetation and rubbish

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lockhurst Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees in garage area leaning on and damaging our garden fence, 14th July
item.description:
Trees growing in the garage area between Park Mead and Westerham Drive are leaning against and have damaged our garden fence (32 Westerham Drive)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66-71, Westerham Drive, Blendon, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping on Lassall Street, 14th July
item.description:
The fly tipping here is a disgrace. We have complained to the council on numerous occasions about it since June. Nothing has been done about it and, in fact, the situation is has worsened. The Greenwich website says that the council aims to deal with fly tipping within 24 hours. It’s been a month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Orlop Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Could you kindly arrange for a mechanical sweep around the traffic island at the bottom of Gravel Hill, where it meets the roundabout? There is a noticeable accumulation of stones and gravel debris. A compact footpath sweeper would be suitable for this location—manual sweeping is not necessary to achieve the desired result. Thank you in advance for your assistance., 14th July
item.description:
This is a heavily used roundabout, and mechanically sweeping the island will make a noticeable improvement to the appearance of the area as vehicles enter Gravel Hill and approach Bexleyheath. Many thanks for your attention to this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Hill, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping o/s uplands primary school, 14th July
item.description:
White van pulled up, 2 male occupants. Rubbish unloaded from side door and dumped on pavement. Vehicle drove off at speed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stratton Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin the wrong way round, 14th July
item.description:
The refuge lorry emptied the bin today then returned one the wrong way round so no one can actually use it. These are used by the people on the street food lunchtime market and get full quickly, once full people throw their rubbish next to the bin. We’re now at 50% capacity so expect there to be a black bag mountain with a food container crust by tomorrow afternoon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chequer Street, Finsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
